SEARCH

Package org.hd.d.TRVmodel.hg

package org.hd.d.TRVmodel.hg
Recreating and generalising the heat-pump / TRV / energy interactions from Heat Geek's page: https://www.heatgeek.com/why-not-to-zone-heat-pumps-or-boilers/ as of ~2023-06.

This is examining if turning down TRVs in unused rooms saves energy or not, as is commonly assumed eg with gas-fired heating.

This is a simple model, mirroring the page above.

  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    org.hd.d.TRVmodel
    Top-level package for TRVModel, contains main().
    org.hd.d.TRVmodel.data
    Loading and decoding data.
  • Class
    Description
    HGTRVHPMModel
    Recreation of the heat-pump / TRV / energy interactions from Heat Geek's page: https://www.heatgeek.com/why-not-to-zone-heat-pumps-or-boilers/ as of ~2023-06.
    HGTRVHPMModelByHour
    Drives the parameterised HG model variant(s) with hourly external temperature data.
    HGTRVHPMModelByHour.ScenarioResult
    Results of running a model against a temperature set.
    HGTRVHPMModelExtensions
    Simple static extensions to the recreation of the heat-pump / TRV / energy interactions from Heat Geek's page: https://www.heatgeek.com/why-not-to-zone-heat-pumps-or-boilers/ as of ~2023-06.
    HGTRVHPMModelParameterised
    Parameterised recreation of the heat-pump / TRV / energy interactions from Heat Geek's page: https://www.heatgeek.com/why-not-to-zone-heat-pumps-or-boilers/ as of ~2023-06.
    HGTRVHPMModelParameterised.DemandWithoutAndWithSetback
    Home heat and electricity demand with and without setback in B rooms; both non-null.
    HGTRVHPMModelParameterised.HeatAndElectricityDemand
    Heat demand and the electricity input to the heat pump to meet it (W).
    HGTRVHPMModelParameterised.ModelParameters
    Parameters for this version of the model.
    ShowComputations
    Show computations from the Heat Geek TRV/HP model.
